Title:
Two new species with nearly hyaline spores in the candolleana
clade of Psathyrella from China
Keywords:
Basidiomycete, new taxon, phylogenetic analysis,
taxonomy
Abstract:
The species with pale spores in the Psathyrella is rare.
However, two unrecorded species of Psathyrella were collected many times
and distributed in many provinces during the investigations in
subtropics China from 2016-2019. Morphological characteristics and
phylogenetic analyses (ITS, LSU, β-tub, and tef-1α) show that they are
unique and distinct from known species, which are named as P. subcacao
and P. subminutispora. The detailed description, color photos,
illustrations, and a key to related species are presented in this
paper.
